flavor.description: is almost always primarily defensive
flavor.name: Algiz

flavor.description: tends toward abstractness. The power's workings are complex and not immediately obvious, both to others and to yourself
flavor.name: Ansuz

flavor.description: is continually active in some form or works on a cycle
flavor.name: Berkano

flavor.description: works in short bursts of extreme power
flavor.name: Dagaz

flavor.description: is cooperative, but less in the sense of many people and more in the sense of just two (the user and someone or something else)
flavor.name: Ehwaz

flavor.description: operates on some sort of fuel
flavor.name: Fehu

flavor.description: involves some kind of equal exchange
flavor.name: Gebo

flavor.description: works from the culmination of many small factors, rather than one large one; a Hagalaz Master would form many weak minions instead of a single powerful one
flavor.name: Hagalaz

flavor.description: has effects last for a long time
flavor.name: Ihwaz

flavor.description: works over large time scales, growing stronger the longer it is applied
flavor.name: Inguz

flavor.description: reduces or nullifies change in some way
flavor.name: Isa

flavor.description: requires some kind of buildup before it can be used
flavor.name: Jera

flavor.description: interacts with human-built things rather than natural things
flavor.name: Kenaz

flavor.description: tends to work on natural materials
flavor.name: Laguz

flavor.description: tends to work on humans, either the body or the mind
flavor.name: Mannaz

flavor.description: has unpredictable effects which tend to adapt towards the current situation
flavor.name: Naudiz

flavor.description: benefits only the user, and not others
flavor.name: Othala

flavor.description: is to some degree uncontrollable
flavor.name: Perthro

flavor.description: tends toward the physical, and involves freedom and the breaking of bonds
flavor.name: Raido

flavor.description: induces change in some fashion
flavor.name: Sowilo

flavor.description: is straightforward, easy-to-understand, and offensive
flavor.name: Thurisaz

flavor.description: is offensive, but requires some sort of sacrifice to use
flavor.name: Tiwaz

flavor.description: is limited in versatility, but very good at what it does
flavor.name: Uruz

flavor.description: is teamwork-oriented, encouraging synergy
flavor.name: Wunjo

twist.description: Your power will prevent your first death, instead providing a second trigger. Roll again and apply the Zodiac (flavor) to your second power.
Your power bypasses some limit it might otherwise be bound by. Increase your choice of Control or Versatility, but decrease Potency.
Your power has a drawback. Increase Control and Versatility, but decrease Potency.
You have a wide array of minor powers rather than one single power; roll Sign and Rune again, twice each. Increase your choice of Control or Versatility, but decrease Potency (applied to all powers).
You don't get along with your power, making it harder to use. Decrease Potency and your choice of Versatility or Control.
Increase your choice of Versatility or Control, but decrease Potency.
You and your power are relatively in sync. Increase your choice of Versatility or Control, but Decrease Potency.
You understand your power, making it easier to use. Increase Potency and your choice of Versatility or Control.
You and your power are morally opposed. Increase your choice of Versatility or Control, but decrease Potency.
Dramatically increase your Versatility or Control, but dramatically decrease Potency.
Your power has a significant secondary usage in another class. Increase your choice of Versatility or Control, but decrease Potency.
Your power is different than what others might think it to be, and may have subtle aspects unnoticed by others. Increase your choice of Versatility or Control, but decrease Potency.
Your power is less straight-up strong but lends itself towards teamwork and combos with other powers. Increase your choice of Versatility or Control, but decrease Potency.
Your power has strength but is incredibly unethical. Increase your choice of Versatility or Control, but decrease Potency.

Finally, you drew The Fool - 0, Reversed. Your power requires a specific mental or emotional state to reach it's full potential. This can be anything from calm to rage but with out it your power is a shadow of what you could be.
Finally, you drew The Fool - 0. Your power alters your personality in some way when you use it most likely in the direction of mania.

Finally, you drew The Magician - I, Reversed. Your power has or had a permanent effect on your heart or mind. It may have been a one off change or it my be something that gets a bit worse with each use of the power.

Finally, you drew The Magician - I. You received some sort of boost (mental or physical) to a normal human attribute that complements your existing power. The boost is significant but definitely not super human in scale.

Finally, you drew The High Priestess - II, Reversed. Your power acts on your behalf apart from your conscious direction. This can be an automatic response to circumstance or in response to mental or emotional states and can work for or against you dependent on the power.

Finally, you drew The High Priestess - II. Your power has an element that is hard to understand which is tripping you up. Careful study may allow you to figure it out but it will remain an impediment.
Finally, you drew The Empress - III, Reversed. Your power works best on or in large groups and suffers when you are alone.

Finally, you drew The Empress - III. You have a secondary or tertiary power that is next to impossible to detect and that takes a long time to use but can be a real game changer when leveraged intelligently.
Finally, you drew The Emperor - IV, Reversed. Your power is good at running interference, harassing foes and protecting allies.
Finally, you drew The Emperor - IV. While most powers promote chaos and destruction your power is a force for order. It protects, preserves, organizes, or the like.

Finally, you drew The Hierophant - V, Reversed. Your power makes you a desirable teammate. Perhaps you're a healer, a useful Trump, or just plain powerful, but you won't have trouble finding people who want to work with you ... whether you really want that or not.
Finally, you drew The Hierophant - V. Your power either makes you reliant on others or it makes other subservient to you. Either way it enforces hierarchy and interdependence, willing or not.
Finally, you drew The Lovers - VI, Reversed. Your power includes a feature that seems to work against the rest of it.
Finally, you drew The Lovers - VI. Your power is beautiful and/or iconic in a way that lets you leverage your image. People instantly recognize it.
Finally, you drew The Chariot - VII, Reversed. Your power is good for harassing and annoying other but lacks direct lethality.
Finally, you drew The Chariot - VII. Your power is typically lethal with little you can do to mitigate this.
Finally, you drew Strength - VIII, Reversed. Your power is a source of constant paranoia. Fear of your power is as useful as the power itself.
Finally, you drew Strength - VIII. Your power grants you protection in some fashion allowing you to leap into the fray with little concern that you'll be harmed in any meaningful way.
Finally, you drew The Hermit - IX, Reversed. Your power makes it dangerous for others to be around you, either when you're actively using it or just in general.
Finally, you drew The Hermit - IX. Your power is fragile in some fashion, making it easy to disrupt.

Finally, you drew The Wheel of Fortune - X, Reversed. Your power is a grab bag of smaller separate powers built around a certain theme. Roll two more signs and runes and create separate but thematically connected powers with them.
Your power isn't the strongest but has a habit of coming through in a pinch, hinting at a hidden factor. Roll for your choice of either an extra sign or rune and use it to create the hidden feature.
Finally, you drew Justice - XI, Reversed. Your power punishes you if you don't use it correctly. It may have barriers you can bypass at a cost or it may require certain actions after using it.
Finally, you drew Justice - XI. Your power requires specific external conditions (as opposed to internal mental/emotional conditions) to be met before you can use it.
twist.extra_info: This could be anything from running in circles to feeding the dead to your skeletal minion but it's not a step you can skip.

twist.description: Finally, you drew The Hanged Man - XII, Reversed. Your power molds your thoughts and feeling in a fashion that allows you to use it better. You are more effective because of this but ... is it really you at all?
Finally, you drew The Hanged Man - XII. our power provides you with some deep insight about the world that separates you from those around you. Appearing normal will require effort on your part.

Finally, you drew Death - XIII, Reversed. Using your power leaves you vulnerable. Maybe you become narcoleptic or start hallucinating but either before, during, or after using your power you're effectively unable to act.
Finally, you drew Death - XIII. Something went wrong with your power, some safety mechanism wasn't included when you triggered, and now your power is slowly killing you.
twist.extra_info: Maybe your power creates hard radiation each time you use it and you aren't immune, maybe it subjects your body to harmful g-forces without any sort of intervention, maybe it's just consuming your body or mind as fuel. Whatever it's doing it's not sustainable.

twist.description: Finally, you drew Temperance - XIV, Reversed. Your power has some minor trump aspect that seems kinda superfluous. Like, seriously, what's up with that?
Finally, you drew Temperance - XIV. Your power is Manton limited. It affects either living or nonliving things, but not both.
Finally, you drew The Devil - XV, Reversed. Your power changed your form in a significant enough fashion that you can't hide it, you are a case 53 or mutant.
Finally, you drew The Devil - XV. Your power is fundamentally immoral to use and probably illegal to boot.
Finally, you drew The Tower - XVI, Reversed. Your power's Potency and Control are decreased.
Finally, you drew The Tower - XVI. Your power's Potency, Versatility and Control are all decreased. You received a genuinely weak power. It happens, sorry.
Finally, you drew The Star - XVII, Reversed. Your power's Versatility and Control are decreased.
Finally, you drew The Star - XVII. Your power's Versatility and Control are increased.
Finally, you drew The Moon - XVIII, Reversed. Your power's Potency and Versatility are decreased.
Finally, you drew The Moon - XVIII. Your power's Potency and Versatility are increased.
Finally, you drew The Sun - XIX, Reversed. Your power's Potency and Control are increased.
Finally, you drew The Sun - XIX. Your power's Potency, Versatility, and Control are all increased. You received a truly superb power.
Your power seems to to be deteriorating in some fashion. Maybe it's maximum intensity is decreasing or your Control over it is getting worse but either way it's not like it use to be.

Finally, you drew Judgement - XX. You are one of the rare few to have a second trigger event. Create your power from the sign and rune then roll again and modify your power with the new sign and rune.

Finally, you drew The World - XXI, Reversed. Your power turned you into a monster. You are a walking natural disaster, a waking nightmare, and/or a probable threat to nearly everyone. This isn't something you can stop or Control, your power Controls you.

Finally, you drew The World - XXI. Your power is exceptional in some fashion. It could break some rule about what powers can and can't do, violate some common sense notion about reality, or just seriously out class other similar powers. Regardless of the particulars you have the potential to become a very important/powerful player in the cape scene.
Your power prevents your first death, instead providing a second trigger. Roll another Rune / Flavor for your second trigger.

type.description: augmented minds, or sensory abilities beyond any reasonable human limit, such as x-ray vision
type.name: Aquarius

type.description: an ability that controls or alters the battlefield, such as darkness generation or fields of reversed gravity
type.name: Aries

type.description: the ability to manipulate technology beyond the means of current science
type.name: Cancer

type.description: the ability to move themselves or others. This may be through super speed, teleportation, or other methods
type.name: Capricorn

type.description: control and possibly creation of minions, whether they be humans, bugs, or inanimate constructs
type.name: Gemini

type.description: the ability to apply some kind of effect on touch, such as time-freezing objects or modification of biology
type.name: Leo

type.description: the ability to break certain rules of physics as they apply to the user, sometimes giving new powers while in the 'breaker' state
type.name: Libra

type.description: the ability to change their body into other forms, like a shapeshifter, but often into only one specified form, such as living fog
type.name: Pisces

type.description: powers with some sort of application to stealth or subterfuge, physically (such as darkness generation) or mentally (such as the inability to be perceived as a threat)
type.name: Scorpio

type.description: super durability or physical super strength, such as a personal force-field
type.name: Taurus

type.description: a power that interacts with other powers, such as granting, copying, or modifying powers
type.name: Virgo
